reviewText: It could comfortably be one large game; each issue’s taken me roughly three to four hours thus far with a third yet to go. Issue 1 was blatantly the origin story of The Purple Patriot, while the second issue centres around his struggles against bureaucracy to establish himself as a legitimate superhero. Another one of the bizarre aspects of the game is on how it does this. The previous episode goes out of its way to set up a small collection of tropes that the second issue gleefully expels and then acts really smug about it. It knows what it’s doing in its self-referencing with open jabs thrown at its genre and sly nods aimed towards the fourth wall. It feels like Patriots has got all the set-up out of the way and is now free to set its sights on anything it feels the need to lampoon.\n\nFull Review // http://www.honestgamers.com/12463/pc/supreme-league-of-patriots-issue-2-patriot-frames/review.html

reviewText:
After getting hit in the head, Kyle's personality changed totally as the Purple Patriot. His quest to become a true super hero begins: between framing people, buying a car and finding a patriot cave, his day will be filled! Always with his sidekick Melvin, will our dear hero be the hero the town needs? Who is the Bleeding Heart? And what will happen to the Flamboyant Hero? And Nurse Julie? And the Cold War Warrior? And Consuela?

If you don't mind, I'll copy/paste parts of my review for the first episode, because some remarks for it is valid for Patriot Frames

The core mechanics is a point-and-click. But I wish that the inventory/utility belt was easier to use. I mean, why should I open the inventory for combining items and use the utility belt to... use them in the scene? Being original is good. But being practical is also a good option. I was really confused at that. I would have prefer the combine option in the utility belt. Why? Because I can easily the utility belt by placing my cursor at the bottom of the screen instead of opening the top of my screen and make a click on the box to open the inventory.

Another gameplay problem is that you can easily obtain items... but can't use them before speaking to a character. I don't have an exact example in the head - though I know that for episode 3, I had to ask help to Melvin (as he's also the one giving hints) and it was the only way to go forward.

The dialogues are still in the comedy mood: with the Purple Patriot being mean" (Kyle is a sweet guy
date: when he's Kyle and you'll see it only once in episode 2). Thank god
recommended: Melvin is the wise guy and his job got harder with the personality change. But now
hoursPlayed: I understand that the new Purple Patriot is a parody of all the people that could be racist
helpfulPercent: homophobic but at an extreme. Besides
votesHelpful: while I had a little hard time sometimes to solve the puzzles
votesTotal: I must say that I warmed up to the game.\n\nYet
votesFunny: achievements unlocking every five minutes is really boring after a while. And some are missable
column16: the graphics or the soundtrack are still the same: in a comedy mood
column17: cartoonish and with new locations.\n\nBuy it when it's discounted or in a bundle but I suggest you strongly to play the first episode if you want to follow the story and understand all the references."

reviewText:
Review - Supreme League of Patriots
Supreme League of Patriots is a point and click game wiwth a dash of humor and comedy. The game let's you take the role of both Kyle and Mel as they venture through the world of superheroes and supervillains. The story is a bit slow on the build up but the actual plot is very unique and original. Each issue comprises about 3-4 hours of gameplay depending on how you solve the puzzles in the game. The puzzles are easy and you won't get off track much since Melvin is there to guide you when you don't know/forgot what you should be doing. The dialgoues and voices are great especially Melvin's british accent.

Pros:
+ A great funny story plot
+ Great voice acting
+ Great Music (especially each character's BGM)
+ Good Graphics
+ Narrative guide (Mel gives you a hint when you get lost)

Cons:
+ There's a bit of bugs whenever you make Kyle go to an obtacle-full area
+ There are times that the voices become out of sync with the balloons/text that appear

If you're looking for a point and click adventure game full of humor, comedy, patriotism, superheroes and supervillains, then Supreme League of Patriots is a must try for you.

I already finished all 3 issues and I just can't wait for season 2! :D

reviewText:
I recommend this title under the same conditions as my review of part 1!

This was my favourite game of the three, it had more in it than the first and I found that I was actually rooting (for and against) certain characters. I liked the different places and scenarios in this one, but again, there were a couple of places where I had to resort to clicking everything on everything else and travelling backwards n forwards to see if I'd missed anything (I had, but that would be a spoiler, so I say nothing!). Apart from that, my only real gripe was that not enough was made of Kyle's superpowers - they were mentioned, but very underused.

Still, as with part one, an excellent 'filler' type game to give yourself a chill break.

reviewText:
Μπορεί να μη γέλασα πολύ, σίγουρα όμως διασκέδασα με την πρώτη δημιουργία της No Bull Intentions, θαυμάζοντας ταυτόχρονα το πλήθος των ζητημάτων που κατάφεραν να Βρετανοί να θίξουν όσο διαρκεί το παιχνίδι τους. Δε θυμάμαι άλλο adventure game που να χαρακτηρίζεται από τόσο διάχυτη και καυστική σάτιρα επί θεμάτων που αφορούν την εποχή κατά την οποία κυκλοφορεί. Κυριολεκτικά καταπιάνεται μ’ ένα σωρό –ευαίσθητα- θέματα, προσπαθώντας να περάσει ανθρώπινα μηνύματα και ν’ αποτελέσει ευθεία και δυνατή φωνή ενάντια στην εκδήλωση κάθε μορφής βίας και ρατσισμού.

Can't remember another adventure game that features such caustic satire on real life phenomena of the era it's getting released. It tries to send various messages in all directions and become a strong voice against violence and racism events.

http://www.ragequit.gr/reviews/item/supreme-league-of-patriots-pc-review
